data.event: Europeans first passed through the area in 1769 when Gaspar de Portolà led a Spanish expedition north to Monterey.
From the description recorded in the diary of Father Juan Crespi, it seems likely that the party camped on July 29 near present-day Laguna Lake, in the Sunny Hills area.

event.title: establishment of Mission San Gabriel Arcangel in 1771

data.event: After establishment of Mission San Gabriel Arcangel in 1771, the local Tongva people were dubbed "Gabrieliños" by the Spanish.
In 1837, the Fullerton area became part of Rancho San Juan Cajón de Santa Ana, granted to Juan Pacifico Ontiveros, a Spanish soldier.
